title.narrative: Building Resilience to natural Hazards in Central Vietnam - consortium led by American Red Cross with USAID OFDA as primary donor

description.narrative: 1. Increased capacity of grassroots Intergenerational Self Help Clubs (ISHCs), local NGOs and local government to design and manage well-coordinated vulnerable group centred DRR and Climate Change Adaption (CCA) interventions with a focus on community preparedness and resilient livelihoods in 60 coastal and rural communities

2. Improved participation and inclusion of vulnerable groups, and particularly older people (a substantial proportion of whom have disabilities), in DRR and resilience activities through the formation of pro-active Intergenerational Disaster Preparedness Teams (IDPTs) in 60 target communities.

3. Increased understanding amongst at least 120 key decision makers at regional, national and local levels about the particular needs, skills and knowledge of older people in disaster scenarios and how these can be addressed. This will have benefits for the disaster resilience of older and disabled people in coastal communities throughout Vietnam.

To increase the disaster resilience of vulnerable groups in coastal communities in Vietnam and build the capacity of government, NGOs and civil society in implementing vulnerable group centred DRR measures.This project builds on work which has established a network of innovative Intergenerational Self Help Clubs – making use of this network to lead at risk group centred disaster risk reduction activities. The presence of a significant proportion of older members in these groups means it will be possible to draw on their knowledge and experience of past disasters and understanding of traditional measures for reducing risk. Advocacy work will also be done on vulnerable group centred DRR at a national level, ensuring vulnerable groups' voices are heard by key decision makers.

mailing-address.narrative: Tavis House, 1-6 Tavistock Square, London WC1H 9NA
